thread.title: Union stunned by Rochester
thread.title_full: Union football stunned by Rochester - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: Union stunned by Rochester
text:
Rochester overcame a 30-13 deficit with three touchdowns in the final 7 minutes, 37 seconds to stun Union 33-30 game Saturday at Edwin Fauver Stadium in Rochester.
Senior quarterback Justin Redfern threw three touchdown passes in those final minutes to rally the Yellowjackets (5-2, 3-2 Liberty League) to the win.
Redfern connected on a four-yarder and an 18-yarder to Farid Adenuga to bring Rochester within 30-27 with 2:19 to play. He threw a 50-yard TD pass to Kyle Allegrini right after the Yellowjackets recovered the ensuing kickoff when it bounced off a Union player. That put Rochester ahead 33-30.
Union (0-7, 0-4) made one last attempt to pull out the game in the final seconds.
Dutchmen quarterback Dante Cioffi completed 5 of 11 passes and moved Union from its own 38 to the Rochester 20 with 50 seconds to play. David Pope's potential game-tying 37-yard field goal attempt was blocked by Rochester's Isaiah Smith on fourth down.
Redfern completed 21 of 35 passes for 384 yards and four touchdowns, which tied a single-game school record held by seven other players.
Union's Cioffi completed 28 of 53 passes for 325 yards, four touchdowns, and one interception. Kyle Reynolds had 11 catches for 161 yards and three TDs. The Dutchmen passed for 325 yards and rushed for 147 yards, 103 of it by Jermain Carn on 17 carries.
Pope kicked a 25-yard field goal to push Union's lead to 23-10 with 6:36 left in the third quarter.
Cioffi ate up clock and yardage with a 15-play, 65-yard drive that took 8:31. He threw an 18-yard TD pass to Reynolds with 10:28 left in the game. That gave the Dutchmen a 30-13 advantage.
